So last night I was asking her about helping me get starbound, but apparently she "used up her credit card buying Christmas presents" when I said "you bought me a new computer didn't you" she quickly said no nd that she didn't have any money,

Lies...

Off topic: I'm getting starbound after Christmas

when I said "you bought me a new computer didn't you"

1. Stop being so greedy!

2. If she said "yes, now wait until christmas".. On christmas the gift wouldn't be as good..

3. Gifts are supposed to be a thoughtful exchange, not a monetary item.

4. You better be getting your mother a really nice gift yourself, it will mean more to her to see a thoughtful gift from you then the entire lifespan of your computer.

5. Seriously, get a thoughtful gift.

6. I really hope you do get the computer

..I remember one year I thought the same thing was happening to me and it turned out I got something equally as awesome but completely different. I'm sure if I was being filmed my reaction to this sweet gift was probably disappointment upon first sight. Not disappointment because of the gift itself, but disappointed that "someone didn't buy me exactly want I wanted". I realized shortly after that is not a good mentality to have, it brings out poor judgement and values.

ps - I never thought "someone must buy this exact item for me", I just convinced myself that my mom had bought the item for me and her denial was a bluff. boy it sucked when I unwrapped it and she wasn't bluffing.

She isn't even obliged to buy you anything! It is just a pure act of kindness to revive you with gifts. Some children don't get any presents for Christmas, so don't be greedy. Once you get a job you will realize how hard it is to get money.

It's profound how much knowledge is gained from the often said "The gift of giving" once you fully understand what it means to give.

Thanks, gang! This thread makes me feel better about being an old fart. I bought myself a new KSP computer just 3 weeks back. A **** beast, too! I splurged on a high-end MSI gaming laptop. Way expensive, but I'm disabled and literally spend every waking minute in this chair at this laptop, so what the hell, right?

And if your parents can't afford a new PC, see if they'll go for a solid-state drive for your old one. Makes a big difference. For me, with lots o'mods, KSP starts in 1:20 from the SSD vs 3:30 from disk.

Merry Christmas, and good luck!

Well, that i3 probably runs KSP better than your i5, as (depending on the model) it could well be faster per core. Since KSP only runs on a single thread (sort of), having four is no advantage. Having a newer generation Intel with a higher clock will mean better performance.

That being said, the venerable i5 760 is still a very capable processor.
